performances.description: Killer show with a great Saint Of Circumstance.
Abosulte beast of a version.. ferocious leads by Garcia Weir nails vocals. Vince piano and Synth work is top notch. All Time BEST
Smoking St of Circumstance in Europe, this is stellar.

performances.venue: Radio City Music Hall New York, NY
performances.description: This should be on here if not for any other reason than Jerry doesn't F up the spacey chords after any of the choruses.  WOO HOO!!!!  :)

performances.venue: Sam Boyd Silver Bowl Las Vegas, NV
performances.description: Great show with a great Saint Of Circumstance.
part of fantastic Dark Star-> Saint of Circumstance->Eyes of the World Sequence
If you have the opportunity, please listen to this off the new 30 Trips Around the Sun boxed set. This is a GREAT show. The quality is amazing.
Uptempo standalone cranker - GoGo powder fast.
Great Saint, though the goods are in the MLB > Dear Prudence jam that follows.  I can only imagine the level of blue balls in the house for that tease

performances.venue: Barton Hall - Cornell University Ithaca, NY
performances.description: BOOM! We discover on this Spring day we are SAINTS. The band begins climbing a crescendo, and we follow it...and fight the bulls of fate and time
a rare one from 1981 without sailor, rocks out of space.
Explosive. Crazy energy

performances.venue: Barton Hall - Cornell University Ithaca, NY
performances.description: Saints into BP????

performances.venue: Greek Theatre - University of California Berkeley, CA
performances.description: Jerry dials his tone in early and contributes in a big way.
The weather was dreadfully hot and Jerry was in poor health but the show is much better than is to be expected. THis the looks like rain are very good
My favorite stand-alone version. This one absolutely rocks.
One of the best shows of 1993.  This version is thick with everyone giving it.  Peaks nicely and then nice Bob rap.
Nice Saint Of Circumstance.
A triumphant, and surprisingly well-played version, given the date. Sure don't know...

performances.venue: Folsom Field, University of Colorado Boulder,
performances.description: Space > Whole band goes for it fo' sho'

performances.venue: Madison Square Garden New York, NY
performances.description: This is hot bridge between eyes and a hot dark star jam.
Killer Jerry solo. Great version all around. Solid Vince.  Nice rap.
Excellent Vince era ST. of Circumstance, real nice jam. One of the Best post Brent versions
F-bomb worthy

performances.venue: Buckeye Lake Music Center Hebron, OH
performances.description: very long pre drums in the pouring rain
Some cool dissonance going on in parts of the jam. We want Phil chant before too

performances.venue: Madison Square Garden New York, NY
performances.description: Awesome version - well constrtucted and executed,.
Beautiful Later version!
Solid vocals and dizzying instrumentals building to a climax.

performances.venue: Madison Square Garden New York, NY
performances.description: this one really rocks, hot number
Rockin!!! Gross negligence of no mention!!!
Shred fest, this deserves to be here. Excellent Bobby and Jerry throughout.

performances.venue: Veterans' Memorial Coliseum New Haven, CT
performances.description: Bobby feeling' it, "What the F**K you gonna DO now?!"
Nice version after a pleasing Iko Iko in an underrated show.
Very hot late era version with several peaks.
Sweetness is here, rocking later day version, oh its heady to me. I don't know what Im going for but Im gonna go for it for sure. Peace

performances.venue: Henry J. Kaiser Convention Center Oakland, CA
performances.description: Comes out of a magical Mardi Gras parade. The band's on point. Good energy. They do flop the ending chant lol. I blame Healy's obnoxious messin around
Bobby is passionate here! Vince is super on this night. Phil with backing bombs. Jerry's solo goes places and is tight. Good performance!

performances.venue: Sam Boyd Silver Bowl Las Vegas, NV
performances.description: Eyes->Box->Saint

performances.venue: Madison Square Garden New York, NY
performances.description: Meandering outro jam into drumz that picks up steam right at the end.

performances.venue: Radio City Music Hall New York, NY
performances.description: Wheel > Saint > Peter. Who had that on their bingo blotters? Doubt all were on the same page here...Bobby puts in the extra effort to justify the call

performances.venue: Greek Theatre, U. Of California Berkeley, CA
performances.description: Decent, if sloppy, set opener. Nice pairing with Gimme Some Lovin.
....outta space!
Smoking hot version!
They are trying hard on this one...not sure that it comes together.

performances.venue: Buckeye Lake Music Center Hebron, OH
performances.description: Great late era ripper long after it lost its beautiful partner. Ripping Garcia solo.
wicked from a truly underrated show.

performances.venue: Autzen Stadium - University of Oregon Eugene, OR
performances.description: Part of a "rain" set, this version has great energy and features Phil dropping a stadium-vibrating bomb.

performances.venue: Deer Creek Music Center Noblesville, IN
performances.description: Hot, hot version that I can't believe hasn't been added yet. The boys seemed to have fun this night.
Flaming smoker, snug like fav jeans washed. Magisterial bruce, mystically ascendant feelings. Hot nite
devils catch a break on this one, everyone gets a nice tone workout
Not a song i seek out but this version found me hot with a real nice interesting jam at the end of it.
